text.scrapedText: GRAMMAR Past perfect  iSLCollective.com

The film started Luis arrived at the cinema  What happened first?  Describe an action which was completed before another action in the past  The film started   Luis arrived to the cinema  PAST  At 7 pm   At 7:30 pm  1st  2nd  The film   had already started  WHEN  Luis   arrived   at the cinema  iSLCollective.com
What happened first?  ● When Luis arrived to the cinema,   the film  had already started .  Add comma if you start with the dependent clause  iSLCollective.com
What happened first?  ● The film had already started   when Luis  arrived to the cinema  It’s no necessary to add a comma if the word WHEN is in the middle.  iSLCollective.com

Pre- grammar  We also use PAST PERFECT to describe an action which was completed before a specific point of time in the past.  By the time he was 14,   he had already started a bank.  PAST  At age of 14  iSLCollective.com

Pre- grammar  We also use PAST PERFECT to describe an action which was completed before a specific point of time in the past.  My mom had finished cooking lunch   by noon (12:00 pm).  PAST  10:00 AM   11:40 PM  My mom started cooking   My mom finished cooking  iSLCollective.com

FOR ACTIONS WHICH TOOK PLACE BEFORE A SPECIFIC POINT OF TIME OR ANOTHER ACTION IN THE PAST.  SHE   HAD FINISHED   HER HOMEWORK BY 7 O’ CLOCK.  THE BUS   HAD LEFT   BY THE TIME WE   ARRIVED   AT THE STATION.  WHEN TO USE IT  Past perfect  SHE   HADN’T   FINISHED   HER HOMEWORK BY 7 O’ CLOCK.  iSLCollective.com
SUBJECT   HAD   VERB IN  PAST  PARTICIPLE  Grammar  iSLCollective.com

Charlie had finished his homework by 10 o’clock last night.

text.scrapedText: Time expressions  Simple past Past perfect  had + past participle Before, when after, as soon as, until, before, when, by the time, already  My mom   had already cooked   lunch   when   I   arrived   home.  She   had gone   to work   before   I   got   home.  I   hadn’t   graduated   from school   by the time   I   was   15.  After   my son   had gone   to bed, I   watched   TV  iSLCollective.com
Finish the sentences  I couldn’t sleep because my neighbors   had organized a noisy party.  Work in pairs  I called the police because   a burglar had tried to enter the house.  iSLCollective.com
Past Perfect  iSLCollective.com
iSLCollective.com
I. Fill in the gaps with the Past Perfect of the verbs given  1.   When I got to the station, the train .................... [already / leave].  had already left had already left  iSLCollective.com
I. Fill in the gaps with the Past Perfect of the verbs given  2. Before I lost my wallet I .............. [lose] my umbrella.  had lost  iSLCollective.com
I. Fill in the gaps with the Past Perfect of the verbs given  3. By the time the doctor arrived, the patient ....................[die].  had died had died  iSLCollective.com
I. Fill in the gaps with the Past Perfect of the verbs given  4. When Anna phoned, I .........[leave] 4. When Anna phoned, I .........[leave] to work.  had left  iSLCollective.com
I. Fill in the gaps with the Past Perfect of the verbs given  5. Before Sarah crossed the road, she................ [look] both ways.  had looked  iSLCollective.com
I. Fill in the gaps with the Past Perfect of the verbs given  6. Before I had a driving license, I.............. [have] a driving test.  had had had had  iSLCollective.com
I. Fill in the gaps with the Past Perfect of the verbs given  7. Before he................ [fill] in the application form, he looked for job offers in the newspaper.  had filled  iSLCollective.com
I. Fill in the gaps with the Past Perfect of the verbs given  8. When I looked up, the burglar ................ [go].  had gone  iSLCollective.com
I. Fill in the gaps with the Past Perfect of the verbs given  9. When the police arrived, the riots............. [stop].  had stopped  iSLCollective.com
iSLCollective.com

Let’s work on it! Optional task  Complete the worksheet using the grammar correctly SIMPLE PAST - PAST PERFECT  1.   After I ______   (finish)   my lunch, I went back to work.  2.   George ________   (repair)   his car before he went fishing.  3.   She _______   (tell)   me she _________   (buy)   a new car.  4.   I _____ (buy)   a new car because some thieves __________   (steal)   my old one.  5.   After the company _____Joe, he began to work on his first project.   (hire)  6.   _____you _______ the news before you saw it on TV?   (hear)  7.   Michael didn’t want to see the movie because he _______ the book yet.   (not read)  8.   The concert ______   already   _______when we _______ the stadium.   (begin/ enter)  9.   Until Anne ________ Mark, she ____   never   ______in love.   (meet, be)  iSLCollective.com
